reviews.text: I have recently stayed in the Abode Manchester and on first appearances the hotel looks fantastic!! The hotel reception staff were first class but this is where this great level of service stopped. The hotel rooms and hall ways are brilliantly decked out but the rooms are a little quirky (but I should have known this from the hotel pics) the floors were not clean i.e. Dusty. This was not a major issue though, that was the restaurant service!!! Great cut of meat in the rib eye steak but the service was terrible and this continued through breakfast which I would never book or pay as much as £11.50 that they charge for a cooked or continental. Black pudding was terrible. I am not a hotel snob but for great service and food the thistle just round the corner is spot on.
reviews.title: Not sure how they got 4 dots!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Abode is situated in Manchester city centre, around 5 minutes walk from Piccadilly station where there is a frequent train service to and from the airport.
reviews.title: Great value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found the staff very helpful and the contemporary designed room very comfortable, especially the extra large bed. There were the usual tea & coffee making facilities and freeview TV and a selection of snacks and soft drinks in the room - although these are not free unless you book a 5th floor suite.
reviews.title: Two nights in a 'Comfortable' double room
new years treat
reviews.text: Downstairs you can visit the award winnning Michael Caine restaurant which is part of the hotel. Although pricey in the evening there are deals to be had, for example a 3 course lunch will cost £15.95 between Sunday and Thursday. There is also a very nice cocktail bar adjacent to the restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I found this hotel very good value for money and its city centre location ideal, highly recommended!
reviews.title: Deliciously different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The most amazing, quirky hotel. we stayed in one of the suites on the top floor and it was fabulous. As they say 'Fabulous on Fifth'. Well worth the price.
reviews.title: Birthday weekend

reviews.text: We also booked a table at the resturant 'Michael Caines'. We had the taster menu with matched wines. What an experience! The food was excellent and the whole experience perfect. They even wrote 'happy birthday' in chocolate sauce on the plate my sweet came on. Wonderful touch.
reviews.title: Brilliant stay, thanks so much!

reviews.text: I would definately stay there again.
reviews.title: Very good service, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value night's stay, have just returned to Spain. From the meet and greet of the lovely Heather, to the wonderful upgrade room, and super meal in the Bar and Grill, all 100%.
reviews.title: Unusual lovely building in good location with great service!

reviews.text: The room was very large, wonderful bed so wide it had 6 pillows! Clean to a fault, great bathroom, toiletries, coffee tray etc
reviews.title: Rather good..

reviews.text: The Building is Impressive. The hotel is inside a Grade II listed Victorian cotton merchant's wholesale warehouse. The original features have been retained, the staircases are very impressive. There are a range of rooms, ranging from standard to Luxury. The standard rooms are functional but nothing special. There always seems to be some humming noise or dripping/banging noise from the pipes which is slightly annoying when you're trying to sleep.
reviews.title: Have stayed here twice now for business

reviews.text: The bathroom has no shelves or anywhere to put your wash bag or toiletries. So you either had to leave these on the floor or leave them on the bed and walk in and out to get things.
reviews.title: Complimentary upgrade! Lovely service! Amazing room! Definite recommendation!

reviews.text: Staff are efficient and informative.
reviews.title: A true birthday treat

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, just across the road from Manchester Piccadilly station and an easy 10 minutes walk from all the shops.
reviews.title: Great hotel for your money
Stayed on business
reviews.text: Like most hotels in the centre of Manchester, there is no car park. There is an NCP round the corner in Chatham Street which is £18 per day.
We have stayed many times now in Abode in Manchester and also in Glasgow.
reviews.title: Room 211? Not the best one -

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have always been extremely impressed and they have done us proud with a large comfortable room and superb massive Emperor bed. We like everything at Abode Manchester and the cafe restaurant serves up absolutely delicious and innovative food - loved my oxtail suet pudding this time, absolutely delicious. Portions are hearty. Good wine list. We have yet to try the downstairs Michael Caines restaurant but we hear it is also very good. One slight disappointment - the cocktails are not cheap and very average.
reviews.title: Fantastic, central location and stylish rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the first time, we found ourselves in a small room - 211. The secret here in Manchester is to ask for a corner room. We forgot and though they realised we are quite regular they still gave us a comparatively modest room, this was disappointing. Wi fi always is excellent in Abode but not this time and until we complained, the wi fi kept cutting out. They seemed to be trying out a different system to the usual facility. It was back to normal after we grumbled. Not quite so sure why.
reviews.title: Great hotel in central Manchester.

reviews.text: Would still strongly recommend Abode Manchester - excellent value - and no doubt we shall return soon.
reviews.title: Fantastic unforgettable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this hotel as I thought the price was reasonable, especially for the central location and also thought the rooms looked nice. Myself and my partner booked the 'Comfortable' room and were pleased to be informed that we had been upgraded (free-of-charge) to a 'Desirable' room as we checked in. The staff at the reception desk were friendly and polite throughout our stay, helping us with taxi bookings and directions. The room itself was stylish with a huge, really comfortable bed. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, especially with the central location. Having stayed at The Malmaison (across the road) in Manchester before, I would definately choose this hotel if i were to visit again - even though both were good i felt this one had the edge.
reviews.title: Location, style and the feel-good factor
